intro: Melothria rechingeri, commonly known as the African sour plum, is a small shrub native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Cucurbitaceae family, which includes cucumbers and gourds. The plant produces small, yellowish-green fruits that are edible when fully ripe. The leaves are heart-shaped and have a slightly hairy texture. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often found in forested areas.
